NAME: Prehistoric
DESCRIPTION: For monuments that can be identified only to a date range from Palaeolithic to Iron Age.

NAME: Early Prehistoric
DESCRIPTION: For monuments which are characteristic of the Palaeolithic to Mesolithic but cannot be specifically assigned.

NAME: Palaeolithic
DESCRIPTION: The period once referred to as the Old Stone Age. It is defined by the practice of hunting and gathering and the use of chipped flint tools. This period is usually divided up into the Lower, Middle and Upper Palaeolithic.

NAME: Lower Palaeolithic
DESCRIPTION: The earliest subdivision of the Palaeolithic, or Old Stone Age; when the earliest use of flint tools appears in the current archaeological record. A hunter gatherer society is a defining characteristic.

NAME: Middle Palaeolithic
DESCRIPTION: The second subdivision of the Palaeolithic or Old Stone Age. Characterized by the fine flake tools of the Mousterian tradition and economically by a hunter gatherer society.

NAME: Upper Palaeolithic
DESCRIPTION: The third and last subdivision of the Palaeolithic or Old Stone Age; characterized by the development of projectile points made from bony materials and the development of fine blade flint tools.

NAME: Mesolithic
DESCRIPTION: The Middle Stone Age, falling between the Palaeolithic and the Neolithic; marks the beginning of a move from a hunter gatherer society towards food producing society.

NAME: Early Mesolithic
DESCRIPTION: The earliest subdivision of the Mesolithic, or Middle Stone Age.

NAME: Late Mesolithic
DESCRIPTION: The latest subdivision of the Mesolithic, or Middle Stone Age.

NAME: Later Prehistoric
DESCRIPTION: For monuments that can be identified only to a date range from Neolithic to Iron Age.

NAME: Neolithic
DESCRIPTION: The New Stone Age, this period follows on from the Palaeolithic and the Mesolithic and is itself succeeded by the Bronze Age. This period is characterized by the practice of a farming economy and extensive monumental constructions.

NAME: Early Neolithic
DESCRIPTION: The earliest subdivision of the Neolithic, or New Stone Age.

NAME: Middle Neolithic
DESCRIPTION: The second subdivision of the Neolithic, or New Stone Age.

NAME: Late Neolithic
DESCRIPTION: The third and latest subdivision of the Neolithic, or New Stone Age.

NAME: Bronze Age
DESCRIPTION: This period follows on from the Neolithic and is characterized by the increasing use of Bronzework. It is subdivided in the Early, Middle and Late Bronze Age.

NAME: Early Bronze Age
DESCRIPTION: The earliest subdivision of the Bronze Age.

NAME: Chalcolithic
DESCRIPTION: The transitional period at the end of the Neolithic when metal is first used to make tools and weapons. New burial rites and artefacts appear at the same time as hese copper implements appear.

NAME: Middle Bronze Age
DESCRIPTION: The second subdivision of the Bronze Age.

NAME: Late Bronze Age
DESCRIPTION: The third and latest subdivision of the Bronze Age.

NAME: Iron Age
DESCRIPTION: This period follows on from the Bronze Age and is characterized by the use of iron for making tools and monuments such as hillforts and oppida. The Iron Age is taken to end with the Roman invasion.

NAME: Early Iron Age
DESCRIPTION: The earliest subdivision of the Iron Age.

NAME: Middle Iron Age
DESCRIPTION: The second subdivision of the Iron Age.

NAME: Late Iron Age
DESCRIPTION: The third and latest subdivision of the Iron Age.

NAME: Roman
DESCRIPTION: The Roman period traditionally begins with the Roman invasion in 43AD and ends with the emperor Honorius directing Britain to see to it's own defence in 410AD.

NAME: 1st Century
DESCRIPTION: Use for phases and events dating to the 1st Century of the common era (1 CE to 100 CE)

NAME: Flavian
DESCRIPTION: Referring to the reigns of the emperors Vespasian (69-79), Titus (79-81) and Domitian (81-96), that coincided with the dynasty established after the death of Nero in 69 CE. Circa 69 CE to 96 CE.

NAME: 2nd Century
DESCRIPTION: Use for phases and events dating to the 2nd Century of the common era (101 CE to 200 CE)

NAME: Hadrianic
DESCRIPTION: Referring to the reign of Hadrian, 117-138 CE.

NAME: Antonine
DESCRIPTION: Referring to the reign of the Roman emperor Antoninus Pius and his successors (from 138 CE) until the late 2nd century. Circa 138 CE to 192 CE.

NAME: Severan
DESCRIPTION: Referring to the Severan dynasty who were emperors of Rome in 193 CE to 235 CE.

NAME: 3rd Century
DESCRIPTION: Use for phases and events dating to the 3rd Century of the common era (202 CE to 300 CE)

NAME: 4th Century
DESCRIPTION: Use for phases and events dating to the 4th Century of the common era (301 CE to 400 CE)

NAME: Early Medieval
DESCRIPTION: This dates from the breakdown of Roman rule in Britain to the Norman invasion in 1066 and is to be used for monuments of post Roman, Saxon and Viking date.

NAME: Anglo-Saxon
DESCRIPTION: Both a political and cultural term: applied to the distinctive culture and artisitic styles that evolved from the merging of native traditions with those of Germanic tribes who had migrated from northern Europe.

NAME: 5th Century
DESCRIPTION: Use for phases and events dating to the 5th Century of the common era (401 CE to 500 CE)

NAME: Early Anglo-Saxon
DESCRIPTION: The first part of the period that saw the arrival of Anglo-Saxon culture (circa 410 to 660 CE).

NAME: 6th Century
DESCRIPTION: Use for phases and events dating to the 6th Century of the common era (501 CE to 600 CE)

NAME: 7th Century
DESCRIPTION: Use for phases and events dating to the 7th Century of the common era (601 CE to 700 CE)

NAME: Mid Anglo-Saxon
DESCRIPTION: The middle part of the Anglo-Saxon period which saw the development of the Seven Kingdoms - the Heptarchy (circa 660 CE to 899 CE).

NAME: 8th Century
DESCRIPTION: Use for phases and events dating to the 8th Century of the common era (701 CE to 800 CE)

NAME: 9th Century
DESCRIPTION: Use for phases and events dating to the 9th Century

NAME: Late Anglo-Saxon
DESCRIPTION: The final part of the Anglo-Saxon period which began with the reign of Edward the Elder and ended with the Norman conquest (circa 899 CE to 1066 CE).

NAME: 10th Century
DESCRIPTION: Use for phases and events dating to the 10th Century

NAME: 11th Century
DESCRIPTION: Use for phases and events dating to the 11th Century

NAME: Medieval
DESCRIPTION: The Medieval period or Middle Ages begins with the Norman invasion and ends with the dissolution of the monasteries.

NAME: Late 11th Century
DESCRIPTION: Y

NAME: 12th Century
DESCRIPTION: Use for phases and events dating to the 12th Century

NAME: High Medieval
DESCRIPTION: The period of European History that lasted from the 11th to the 14th Century.

NAME: 13th Century
DESCRIPTION: Use for phases and events dating to the 13th Century.

NAME: Late Medieval
DESCRIPTION: The period of European history that lasted from the 14th to the Mid 16th Century.

NAME: 14th Century
DESCRIPTION: Use for phases and events dating to the 14th Century.

NAME: 15th Century
DESCRIPTION: Use for phases and events dating to the 15th Century (1401-1500).  For sites and buildings constructed in the Tudor period, double-index with Tudor.

NAME: Post Medieval
DESCRIPTION: Begins with the dissolution of the monasteries and ends with the death of Queen Victoria. Use more specific period where known.

NAME: Tudor
DESCRIPTION: Dating to the reign of the Tudor monarchs.

NAME: 16th Century
DESCRIPTION: Use for phases and events dating to the 16th Century (1501-1600). For sites and buildings constructed in the Tudor style see also TUDOR and ELIZABETHAN

NAME: Elizabethan
DESCRIPTION: Dating to the reign of Elizabeth I of England.

NAME: 17th Century
DESCRIPTION: Use for phases and events dating to the 17th Century (1601-1700). For sites and buildings constructed in the Elizabthan or Jacobean Style see also ELIZABETHAN, STUART and JACOBEAN

NAME: Stuart
DESCRIPTION: Dating to the reign of the Stuart kings of England (including the Commonwealth inter-regnum)

NAME: Jacobean
DESCRIPTION: Dating to the reign of James I of England (VI of Scotland).

NAME: 18th Century
DESCRIPTION: Use for phases and events dating to the 18th Century. For sites and buildings constructed in the Stuart or Georgian periods double-index with the appropriate term.

NAME: Hanoverian
DESCRIPTION: Dating to the reign of the Hanoverian kings.

NAME: Georgian
DESCRIPTION: Dating to or characteristic of the reigns of any of the first four kings of Great Britain called George.

NAME: 19th Century
DESCRIPTION: Use for phases and events dating to the 19th Century. For sites and buildings constructed in the Georgian or Victorian periods double-index with the appropriate term.

NAME: Victorian
DESCRIPTION: Dating to the reign of Queen Victoria.

NAME: Late 19th Century
DESCRIPTION: The final third of the 19th Century.

NAME: 20th Century
DESCRIPTION: Use for phases and events dating to the 20th Century (1901-2000). Previously recorded as 'Modern'.

NAME: Early 20th Century
DESCRIPTION: The first third of the 20th century.

NAME: Edwardian
DESCRIPTION: The period covering the reign of Edward VII. Do not use for the reigns of Edwards I-VI.

NAME: First World War
DESCRIPTION: Used to record buildings, defensive monuments and sites dating to, and associated with, the First World War. For other types of building, such as houses, built during this period use EARLY 20TH CENTURY.

NAME: Mid 20th Century
DESCRIPTION: The mid third of the 20th Century

NAME: Second World War
DESCRIPTION: Used to record buildings, defensive monuments and sites dating to, and associated with, the Second World War. For other types of building, such as houses, built during this period use MID 20TH CENTURY.

NAME: Late 20th Century
DESCRIPTION: The final third of the 20th century.

NAME: Cold War
DESCRIPTION: The period of political and military opposition between the major Superpowers (USA and USSR) and their allies. Known as the Cold War as there were no direct military conflicts between the two main protagonists.

NAME: 21st Century
DESCRIPTION: Use for phases and events dating to the 21st Century (2001-2100).

NAME: Early 21st Century
DESCRIPTION: The first third of the 21st century.

NAME: Mid 21st Century
DESCRIPTION: The second third of the 21st century

NAME: Solar Federation
DESCRIPTION: The period of the 21st Century when the surviving planets banded together under the Red Star of the Solar Federation.

NAME: Late 21st Century
DESCRIPTION: The final third of the 21st century.

NAME: Uncertain
DESCRIPTION: Catch all for uncertain period allocations
